content: Yes, as an AI language model, I have access to Maya Angelou's published works, which go beyond her poetry. She was also well known for her autobiographical books, including "I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings," which describes her early life and childhood experiences, and "Gather Together in My Name," which follows her life as a young mother and sex worker in San Francisco. Her other books include essay collections, such as "Letter to My Daughter," and children's books, including "Life Doesn't Frighten Me." Throughout her writing, Angelou shares her experiences and reflections on personal struggles, social justice, and the human condition, making her work a rich and insightful contribution to literature.
